definition: old variant of 慨[kai3]/to sigh (with emotion)

sentences.english: Everyone feels resentment at being treated unfairly.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都会为受到不公平的待遇而感到愤慨。

sentences.english: We outrage at the sinful violation of the poeple's interests and rights.
sentences.chinese: 我们对侵犯人民利益和权利的罪恶行经表示强烈愤慨。

sentences.english: These regressive behaviors have already triggered strong indignation of the Chinese people.
sentences.chinese: 这些人的倒行逆施已经引起了中国民众的强烈愤慨。

sentences.english: It expresses the anger that many former Lehman employees still feel toward Mr Fuld.
sentences.chinese: 书中表达了许多原雷曼兄弟员工对福尔德先生的愤慨。

sentences.english: A cavalier attitude to expenses incensed voters at home.
sentences.chinese: 他在花费支出上的大手大脚令全国选民为之愤慨。

sentences.english: In my fury, I dashed all the dishes to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 愤慨之下，咱把所有得杯盘都摔到地上去拉。

sentences.english: It transforms a natural repugnance into a moral shock.
sentences.chinese: 它把一个自然的抵触转化为了一个道德的愤慨。

sentences.english: Already, in 2003, children in charcoal had scandalized people around the world.
sentences.chinese: 在2003年，在木炭业的儿童们使全世界的人愤慨。

sentences.english: I was scandalized at his words.
It caused some protest and indignation.
sentences.chinese: 这引起了一些抗议和愤慨。

sentences.english: However, Summerville's ire was the least of her worries afterward.
sentences.chinese: 然而事后，她略微担忧索姆威勒的愤慨。

sentences.english: The lèse-majesté law is an outrage in itself.
sentences.chinese: 《欺君法》本身就是一件令人愤慨的事。

sentences.english: Many of the schools were built with inadequate reinforcements, prompting public outrage.
sentences.chinese: 许多黉舍修建尺度分歧划定，导致了黎庶的愤慨。

sentences.english: The public was outraged when the vardened criminal was released from prison.
sentences.chinese: 那个屡教不改的惯犯从监狱里释放时，公众感到愤慨。

sentences.english: The maltreatment of the old man by his son aroused great public indignation .
sentences.chinese: 这起儿子虐待老人的事件，引起了群众的极大愤慨。

sentences.english: But of course, we do get angry replies.
sentences.chinese: 当然了，我们确实会收到网友们愤慨的回复。

definition: righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
to criticize harshly/to denounce/to attack viciously
variant of 憤憤不平|愤愤不平[fen4 fen4 bu4 ping2]
